result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laryan Jeron Moore

records.addlTxt: Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Swanson, Br. 11.

Defendant Laryan Jeron Moore appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Laryan Jeron Moore.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective Maxwell Ours.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 11.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Laryan Jeron Moore not in court, in custody in Waukesha County.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Laryan Jeron Moore.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness was present. Defendant in Waukesha County for court and not produced. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Laryan Jeron Moore not in court, in custody at Dodge Correctional.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defendant not produced due to scheduling issues. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Laryan Jeron Moore not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Mr Moore was moved from Waukesha to Dodge yesterday; unable to appear by video for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Laryan Jeron Moore not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court; denied. State to do an order to produce from Waukesha for the next date. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Marcelino C-B
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Laryan Jeron Moore in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant Laryan Jeron Moore in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Laryan Jeron Moore appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
